SENT.plain: Tc-99m HMPAO single photon emission computed tomography was performed in a patient who had experienced aphasia for 3 days
The patient had a medical history of subarachnoid hemorrhage and intracranial hemorrhage
Both of these hemorrhages were related to a dural arteriovenous malformation that was embolized after the onset of the cerebral vascular events
Focal hyperperfusion was seen in the left temporal lobe adjacent to a perfusion defect corresponding to the old cerebral hemorrhage
The finding was interpreted as the focus of the patient's epilepsy
His aphasia resolved after the administration of anticonvulsant medication for several days
